member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.ButtonsPath
member.summary: Sets the path to custom buttons on site.
member.remarks: Pictures should be named: Export.gif, First.gif, First_disabled.gif, Last.gif, Last_disabled.gif, Next.gif, Next_disabled.gif, Prev.gif, Prev_disabled.gif, Print.gif, Refresh.gif, Zoom.gif

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.ShowRtfExport

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfJpegQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality of Jpeg images in RTF file.
member.remarks: Default value is 90. This property will be used if you select Jpeg in the property.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the image format that will be used to save pictures in RTF file.
member.remarks: Default value is Metafile. This format is better for exporting such objects as MSChartObject and ShapeObject.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfPictures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that pictures are enabled.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfPageBreaks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that page breaks are enabled.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfWysiwyg
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the wysiwyg mode should be used for better results.
member.remarks: Default value is true. In wysiwyg mode, the resulting rtf file will look as close as possible to the prepared report. On the other side, it may have a lot of small rows/columns, which will make it less editable. If you set this property to false, the number of rows/columns in the resulting file will be decreased. You will get less wysiwyg, but more editable file.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfCreator
member.summary: Gets or sets the creator of the document.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.RtfAutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the rows in the resulting table should calculate its height automatically.
member.remarks: Default value for this property is false. In this mode, each row in the resulting table has fixed height to get maximum wysiwyg. If you set it to true, the height of resulting table will be calculated automatically by the Word processor. The document will be more editable, but less wysiwyg.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.ShowMhtExport
member.summary: Switch visibility of MHT (web-archive) export in toolbar.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.MhtPictures
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating that pictures are enabled.

member.name: P:FastReport.Web.WebReport.MhtWysiwyg
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the wysiwyg mode should be used for better results.
member.remarks: Default value is true. In wysiwyg mode, the resulting rtf file will look as close as possible to the prepared report. On the other side, it may have a lot of small rows/columns, which will make it less editable. If you set this property to false, the number of rows/columns in the resulting file will be decreased.
